name: Lead Magnet Post
description: Post that offers a valuable free resource in exchange for engagement, designed to generate leads
use_when: Promoting a free guide, template, or resource
Building your email list or audience
Launching a new lead magnet or content asset

guidelines: Include specific numbers or results when possible
Keep under 140 characters to avoid truncation
examples: Yesterday I spent 6.5 hours creating 4 (massive) AI prompts to help you:
I charge $5,000 to implement this system for my clients. But f*ck it - I'll give you all my prompts & templates for free…

big_promise.purpose: Explain the specific outcome or problem your lead magnet solves
guidelines: Be specific about results or benefits
Use bullet points for easy scanning

reason_why.purpose: Explain why you're giving this away (increases conversion)
guidelines: Create urgency with time limits if applicable
Keep paragraphs under 3 lines for mobile readability

offer_stack.format: Bulleted list of everything included in the lead magnet
guidelines: Make each feature tangible and specific
Add numbers or dollar values when possible
Start with 'It includes:' or similar phrase

cta.format: Clear instructions on how to get the lead magnet
guidelines: Keep it simple: like, comment, connect
examples:
Want access?
• Like this post
• Comment "welcome"
• Send me a connection request (so I can DM you)

ps.purpose: Increase conversion with social proof or handle objections
guidelines: Can tease an additional benefit not mentioned earlier

quality_criteria.description: Stops scroll with curiosity or bold claim

formatting_guidelines: Avoid paragraphs longer than 3 lines on mobile
Use '•' for bullet points (no markdown on LinkedIn)
Use line breaks and '...' to break up text
forbidden_patterns: Don't use vague descriptions of the lead magnet
Don't forget to specify exact comment text
examples: I used to believe webinars were stupid. But guess what? I was dead wrong...
Yesterday I spent 6.5 hours creating 4 (massive) AI prompts to help you:
I charge $5,000 to implement this system for my clients. But f*ck it - I'll give you all my prompts & templates for free…

tone: Bold and confident claims when backed by results
structure: Hook should create a curiosity gap to get clicks on 'see more'
Hook can use 2 short punchy single-sentence paragraphs with line break OR 2-3 line paragraph under 140 characters
Last sentence of hook should always end with a colon (:)
Big Promise should be specific about outcomes or problems solved
Reason Why section increases compliance by explaining motivation
Offer Stack should list all components to increase perceived value
CTA should clearly list steps to get the lead magnet
PS section should start with 'PS -' format
forbidden: No paragraphs longer than 3 lines when viewed on mobile
No vague descriptions of the lead magnet
required_elements: Hooks with big numbers or money figures tend to outperform
Include social proof when explaining outcomes/problems when possible
Make each feature in the Offer Stack tangible and specific
Add numbers or dollar values to features when possible
Keep CTA simple: like, comment, connect
Specify exact comment text in CTA (e.g., 'Comment "template"')
